data.question: What is the primary focus of the sorption studies mentioned in the text?
data.answer: The sorption studies have focused on H2 adsorption, but some studies of the absorption of CO2 and CH4 have been reported.

data.question: Why do the classical zeolite frameworks exhibit little deformation upon loading and unloading of various guest species?
data.answer: Because the classical zeolite frameworks are relatively rigid.

data.question: Is the [V(O)(bdc)] structure flexible enough to undergo single-crystal-to-single-crystal transformations upon absorption of aniline, thiophene, and acetone from the liquid phase?
data.answer: True

data.question: What changes occur in the [V(O)(bdc)] structure upon removal of the guest acid molecules by heating?
data.answer: The framework V3+ ions are oxidized to V4+ without changing the topology of the framework.

data.question: What is the role of the bdc ligands in the structure of [V(O)(bdc)]?
data.answer: The bdc ligands cross-link the octahedral chains to form 1D rhombshaped tunnels.

data.question: How does the intercalation of guest molecules like aniline, thiophene, and acetone affect the space-group symmetry of [V(O)(bdc)]?
data.answer: The intercalation of guest molecules changes the space-group symmetry of [V(O)(bdc)] due to the interactions between the guest molecules and the host framework.

data.question: Can the [V(O)(bdc)] structure revert to its original space group Pnma after desorption of thiophene?
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the significance of the p–p interactions between the aniline molecules and the framework bdc ligands?
data.answer: The p–p interactions facilitate the packing of aniline molecules in the structure and complemented by weak C-H···p and N-H···p interactions.

data.question: Does the [V(O)(bdc)] structure show flexibility without loss of crystallinity?
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the effect of intercalating acetone molecules into the [V(O)(bdc)] structure?
data.answer: The intercalation of acetone molecules leads to the formation of one column along the tunnel axis with an antiparallel packing pattern, causing the tunnel section to flatten substantially.

data.question: Is the guest-molecule packing in the intercalated compounds compatible with the space-group symmetry of [V(O)(bdc)]?
data.answer: False

data.question: What happens to the tunnel openings in [V(O)(bdc)] upon intercalation of guest molecules?
data.answer: The tunnel openings in [V(O)(bdc)] systematically shrink because of the interactions between the guest molecules and the host framework.

data.question: How does the guest-molecule packing density in the intercalated compounds compare to the liquid densities of the guest molecules?
data.answer: The guest-packing densities calculated for the intercalated compounds are approximately 21% lower than the corresponding liquid densities of the guest molecules, assuming full occupancy.

data.question: Is the reversibility of thiophene uptake by [V(O)(bdc)] confirmed by both thermogravimetric and X-ray diffraction studies?
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the role of noncovalent oriented weak interactions in the packing of organic molecules within channels of a specific metal–organic framework?
data.answer: These interactions can cause remarkable deformation and symmetry changes in the framework, pointing to effective ways of manipulating materials or designing new materials with targeted properties.

data.question: Does the [V(O)(bdc)] structure undergo deformation upon intercalation of guest molecules?
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the method used for the synthesis of [V(O)(bdc)](H2bdc)0.71?
data.answer: It was synthesized by hydrothermal reaction from a mixture of VO2, HCl, H2bdc, and H2O, heated at 220°C in a sealed teflon vessel for 3 days.

data.question: How are the intercalation experiments for aniline, thiophene, and acetone carried out?
data.answer: By immersing crystals of [V(O)(bdc)] in liquid aniline, thiophene, and acetone.

data.question: Is the guest-acid content in [V(O)(bdc)](H2bdc)0.71 confirmed by chemical analysis and structure refinements?
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the impact of the weak interactions between guest molecules and the host framework on the stoichiometry of the intercalated compounds?
data.answer: The oriented interactions between the guest molecules and the framework bdc ligands dictate the stoichiometry of the intercalated compounds.
